bibl.title: Leroy Smith v. O.P. Halligan. Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: United States District Court. Western District of Washington.
The President of the United States of America, To O. P. Halligan, Warden of United States Penitentiary, McNeil Island, Washington.

We Command You, that you have the body of Leroy Smith by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Leroy Smith shall be called or charged before the Hon. C. H. HanfordEdward E. Cushman, United States District Judge for the Western District of Washington, at the Cout Room of said Court in the City of Seattle, Washington, in the City of in the Northern Division of said Western District of Washington, on the 23d day of October, 1916 A.D. , at two o'clock in the afternoon to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Leroy Smith. And have you then and there this writ.

WITNESS the Hon. C. H. HANFORDEdward E. Cushman, Judge of the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, this 16th day of October, in the your of our Lord one thousand eightnine hundred and sixteen
By Ed M Lakin Deputy Clerk.
U.S. Civil Docket No. 5501 United States District Court. Western DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
In the Matter of the Application of Leroy Smith For Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Let the within Writ issue. U.S. District Judge.
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division OCT 19 1916 Frank L. Croskby, Clerk, By Ed M Larkin Deputy
